item.name: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

item.title: A bill to designate the annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse located at 333 Constitution Ave. Northwest in Washington, District of Columbia, as the "Judge William B. Bryant Annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse".

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H6502)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H6502)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4294.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H6502-6503)
Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.

item.name: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text: Designates the annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse in Washington, D.C., as the Judge William B. Bryant Annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates the annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse in Washington, D.C., as the Judge William B. Bryant Annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

bill.title: To designate the annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse located at 333 Constitution Avenue Northwest in the District of Columbia as the "William B. Bryant Annex".

item.title: To designate the annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse located at 333 Constitution Avenue Northwest in the District of Columbia as the "William B. Bryant Annex".

To designate the annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse located at 333 Constitution Ave. Northwest in Washington, District of Columbia, as the "Judge William B. Bryant Annex to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
